intro: Athamanta carvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved athamanta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Athamanta carvifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
